context_blocks.content: Governance Principle 1: Every data entity has exactly one system of record. Wix CMS owns deal data, SharePoint owns documents, Business Central owns financials, Dynamics 365 owns contacts/pipeline. All other systems consume via Power Automate or API — never duplicate. Derived data is calculated on read, not stored redundantly. Golden Rule: 'If creating new data, ensure it is in the correct system of record from the start.'

Governance Principle 2: Uniform naming convention [Entity]-[Category]-[Description]-[Version].[ext]. SharePoint has 6 top-level categories: Executive, Corporate, Brands, Marketing, People, Projects, Archive. Deal documents follow /Deals/{dealSlug}/{category}/ structure. Rules: no loose files at root; no personal naming conventions. Project folders numbered sequentially (001, 002, etc.) with subcategories (01-Legal, 02-Financial, 03-Due-Diligence, 04-Marketing).

Governance Principle 3: Zero Redundancy — each agent has primary domain and platform. Claude.ai: strategy/architecture, Claude Code: engineering/deployment, OpenAI: content/analysis, Copilot Studio: client-facing, Power Automate: event-driven workflows. No two agents perform same function on same platform. Escalation: when in doubt, route to Chief Strategy Agent.

Governance Principle 4: 7 brand verticals (Enterprise, Acumen, Advisory, Apeiron, Apogee, AREAops, LUCY) share same infrastructure stack. Each vertical has own Wix CMS collections, SharePoint subfolder, and CRM pipeline. Shared services: authentication, payment processing, email automations, analytics. Design principle: 'Build once, deploy across all brands.'

Governance Principle 5: Role-Based Access Control with 4 tiers — Admin (full control), Escrow (deal-party transaction room access), NDA (investor-level document access), Public (anonymous site visitors). Microsoft services use Entra ID; client-facing portals use Wix Members. Consistent enforcement across Wix Members, SharePoint groups, Dynamics 365 security roles, and Copilot Studio agent access checks.

Governance Principle 6: Weekly operational rhythm — Monday: Power BI dashboard review + pipeline health check; Wednesday: agent performance review + workflow error audit; Friday: backlog grooming in Azure DevOps + sprint planning. Monthly: architecture review, decommission tracking, vendor cost analysis. Quarterly: strategic alignment review, roadmap update, stakeholder presentation.

decisions.decision: Single Source of Truth architecture — no data duplication
decisions.rationale: Prevents data drift, conflicting records, and wasted storage; ensures one authoritative answer for every query
decisions.impact: All integrations must respect system-of-record boundaries

decisions.rationale: 7 verticals sharing infrastructure reduces development cost and ensures consistency
decisions.impact: All new features benefit all brands simultaneously

decisions.decision: 4-tier RBAC security model (Admin, Escrow, NDA, Public)
decisions.rationale: Matches real estate transaction lifecycle access patterns
decisions.impact: Consistent access control across all platforms
